text: Hagerstown I.O.O.F. Hall is a historic Independent Order of Odd Fellows hall located at Hagerstown, Wayne County, Indiana. It was built between 1880 and 1883, and is a three-story, five bay by seven bay, Italianate style brick commercial building. It has a cast iron storefront on the first floor and a low hipped roof. When constructed it had stores on the first floor and an opera house and Odd Fellows hall on the second and third floors. Note: This includes and Accompanying photographs It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1978. ==References== Category:Independent Order of Odd Fellows Category:Commercial buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Italianate architecture in Indiana Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1883 Category:Buildings and structures in Wayne County, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wayne County, Indiana
title: Hagerstown I.O.O.F. Hall
